title: How to Make a Chocolate Lover's Pumpkin Pie

steps.headline: First, prepare the pie crust: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees
Place broken cookies in a food processor and blend until cookies are crumbs.
steps.description: Transfer crumbs to medium bowl, throw on the butter, and mix with fingers until well combined.

steps.headline: Pour crumbs into 9-inch pie plate.
steps.description: Press crumbs evenly up the sides and bottom of the plate.Refrigerate for 20 minutes to firm crumbs, Bake for 10 minutes or until crumbs are set. Cool Slightly

steps.headline: the pie filling: Increase oven temp.
Beat cream cheese, sugar, flour and pumpkin pie spice in large bowl until well blended.
steps.description: Add pumpkin and eggs; beat until well blended. Stir in small chocolate chips; pour batter into prepared crust. Bake 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Reduce oven temperature to 250 °F (121 °C); continue baking 60 minutes or until almost set.
steps.description: Remove from oven to wire rack. With knife, loosen cake from side of pan. Cool completely; remove side of pan. Refrigerate about 5 hours before serving.

text: First, prepare the pie crust: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees  Place broken cookies in a food processor and blend until cookies are crumbs. Transfer crumbs to medium bowl, throw on the butter, and mix with fingers until well combined. Pour crumbs into 9-inch pie plate. Press crumbs evenly up the sides and bottom of the plate.Refrigerate for 20 minutes to firm crumbs, Bake for 10 minutes or until crumbs are set. Cool Slightly the pie filling: Increase oven temp. to 400 degrees. Beat cream cheese, sugar, flour and pumpkin pie spice in large bowl until well blended. Add pumpkin and eggs; beat until well blended. Stir in small chocolate chips; pour batter into prepared crust. Bake 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 250 °F (121 °C); continue baking 60 minutes or until almost set. Remove from oven to wire rack. With knife, loosen cake from side of pan. Cool completely; remove side of pan. Refrigerate about 5 hours before serving. Finished.
